title: Serif — Russian music score
content:
Hello,  
wondering what this font is called?  
Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0605b_4931.jpg)

Font: 

 Bazhanov 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")
author: Emma-L

comments.content:
I think Svetlana ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/svetlana/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/svetlana/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/svetlana/")) comes close.  
Or, even better, Bazhanov ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bazhanov/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bazhanov/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bazhanov/")), which is the original display cut.

EDIT: Don, your posts have more edits than a controversial Wikipedia entry! ;-)

And in Svetlana

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SvetlanaInUse1_6299.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317083145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SvetlanaInUse2_4792.gif)
  
Not a lot of difference.  
Don

Ricardo, it's just the quest for perfection. I have my own Socratic debates :)  
On balance I would recommend Bazhanov since the sample image is titling.  
Don

Agreed on Bazhanov (I just found Svetlana first).

P.S.: if you aim for perfection, you maybe would like to add a |c| to my name... ;-)

BTW the Cyrillic letters have more flair than the Roman ones. Compare the Cyrillic \_К\_ with the Roman \_K\_ and the Cyrillic \_Я\_ with the Roman \_R\_.  
Don

Opps! Apologies Riccardo. & yes you had Svetlana before I did. All I had first was Bazhanov. Not that it makes any difference in the real world beyond the font detective game. :)  
Don

I meant I found Svetlana, then edited my post to add Bazhanov (found looking at Svetlana's description).  
I didn't want by any means to score a point or anything!
